author: lara farnham
description: Immediate actions could be — Mandatory to drink a 200ml water before putting on the suit to feel cooler for up to one hour adding lemon will make it more refreshing. —Wear a wet cloth at the back of the neck, the sensor to make your body think you are cool.—Tiger balm rubbed around the temples could help to relieve the stress and  headaches. —Shift work lasting up to 15 mins —The glove area seems most vunerable petroleum gel  placed around the wrists of the gloves may help the removal of gloves easier and more swift. — An scarf ideally linen worn underneath the helmet could provide protection when removing the helmet.
summary: An all in one  aluminised fire fighters suit with a cooling system under garment worn by astronuts will take time and money to produce but may protect from the virus and keep cool. It seems critical here to improve on what we have, quickly.  What simple considerations can we employ that may help to relief stress for the workers and by doing perhap help to save more lifes including their own?
title: Immediate action
